other_tests.findings: Reduced diffuse I-uptake (5.4%) 24 hours after the oral administration of 100 µCi 123I (normal range 10%–40%). Virtually no uptake in salivary glands and stomach, suggesting a diagnosis of ITD.
Identified a compound heterozygous NIS mutation R124H/V270E.
Abnormally high TSH level (494 mIU/L, cut off 120 mIU/L).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Reexamined at day 11; TSH level was 8.00 mIU/L (0.44–8.80 mIU/L), diagnosed as euthyroid.

other_tests.findings: TSH level 446 mIU/L (normal values 0.50–4.30 mIU/L), free T4 0.1 ng/dL (0.9–1.6 ng/dL).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Six weeks after treatment, her TSH level was 4.36 mIU/L.

other_tests.findings: High serum thyroglobulin (3000 ng/ml, normal 2.0–35.0 ng/ml).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Thyroglobulin levels decreased to 204 ng/ml after 15 months of treatment.
